briefdescription.para: Splitter type.

memberdef.definition: typedef unspecified_type CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::iterator
memberdef.name: iterator

briefdescription.para: Bidirectional const iterator with value type Point_d that allows to enumerate all points in the tree.

briefdescription.para: A handle with value type Kd_tree_node<Traits,Splitter>.

memberdef.name: Node_const_handle

memberdef.definition: typedef unspecified_type CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::size_type
memberdef.name: size_type

briefdescription.para: A type that counts the number of elements in a k-d tree.

memberdef.definition: CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::Kd_tree
memberdef.name: Kd_tree

briefdescription.para: Constructs an empty k-d tree.

memberdef.definition: CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::Kd_tree
memberdef.argsstring: (InputIterator first, InputIterator beyond, Splitter s=Splitter(), Traits t=Traits())
memberdef.name: Kd_tree

briefdescription.para: Constructs a k-d tree on the elements from the sequence [first, beyond) using the splitting rule implemented by s.

detaileddescription.para: The value type of the InputIterator must be Point_d.

memberdef.definition: CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::Kd_tree
memberdef.argsstring: (const PointRange &points, Splitter s=Splitter(), const Traits t=Traits())
memberdef.name: Kd_tree

briefdescription.para: Constructs a k-d tree on the elements from the range points using the splitting rule implemented by s.

detaileddescription.para: The value type of elements in PointRange must be Point_d.

memberdef.definition: void CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::build
memberdef.name: build

briefdescription.para: The constructor does not build the internal data structure, and it is also not updated after calls to insert().

detaileddescription.para: The method build() is called implicitly at the first call to a query or removal member function. You can call build() explicitly to ensure that the next call to query functions will not trigger the reconstruction of the data structure.

parameterdescription.para: enables sequential versus parallel algorithm. Possible values are Sequential_tag, Parallel_tag, and Parallel_if_available_tag. This template parameter is optional: calling build() without specifying the concurrency tag will result in Sequential_tag being used. If build() is not called by the user but called implicitly at the first call to a query or removal member function, Sequential_tag is also used.

memberdef.definition: void CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::invalidate_build
memberdef.name: invalidate_build

briefdescription.para: This clears the internal data structure, which then gets rebuilt either by an explicit call to build() or implicitly by the next query or removal.

detaileddescription.para: The only reason to call this function explicitly is to rebalance the tree after some number of removals.

memberdef.definition: void CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::insert
memberdef.name: insert

briefdescription.para: Inserts the point p in the k-d tree.

simplesect.para: Insertions do not dynamically update the internal data structure. The next query, or a call to build(), automatically triggers a rebuild of the whole structure.

memberdef.definition: void CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::insert
memberdef.name: insert

briefdescription.para: Inserts the elements from the sequence [first, beyond) in the k-d tree.

detaileddescription.para: The value type of the InputIterator must be Point_d.

memberdef.definition: void CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::remove
memberdef.name: remove

briefdescription.para: Removes the point p from the k-d tree.

detaileddescription.para: It uses equal_to_p to identify the point after locating it, which can matter in particular when 2 points are in the same place. IdentifyPoint is a unary functor that takes a Point_d and returns a bool. This is a limited and naive implementation that does not rebalance the tree. On the other hand, the tree remains valid and ready for queries. If the internal data structure is not already built, for instance because the last operation was an insertion, it first calls build().

memberdef.definition: void CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::remove
memberdef.name: remove

briefdescription.para: Removes point p, calling the 2-argument function remove() with a functor that simply compares coordinates.

memberdef.definition: void CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::reserve
memberdef.name: reserve

memberdef.definition: size_t CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::capacity
memberdef.name: capacity

memberdef.definition: std::optional< Point_d > CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::search_any_point
memberdef.name: search_any_point

briefdescription.para: Reports any point that is approximately contained by q.

detaileddescription.para: The types FuzzyQueryItem::Point_d and Point_d must be equivalent. To use this function Traits must be a model of the concept RangeSearchTraits.

memberdef.definition: OutputIterator CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::search
memberdef.name: search

briefdescription.para: Reports the points that are approximately contained by q.

detaileddescription.para: The types FuzzyQueryItem::Point_d and Point_d must be equivalent. To use this function Traits must be a model of the concept RangeSearchTraits.

memberdef.definition: iterator CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::begin
memberdef.name: begin

briefdescription.para: Returns a const iterator to the first point in the tree.

simplesect.para: Starting with CGAL 4.6, the order of the points in the iterator range [begin() , end()) is not the order of insertion of the points into the tree. This was not guaranteed before but might have been observed and exploited.

memberdef.definition: iterator CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::end
memberdef.name: end

briefdescription.para: Returns the appropriate past-the-end const iterator.

memberdef.definition: void CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::clear
memberdef.name: clear

briefdescription.para: Removes all points from the k-d tree.

memberdef.definition: size_type CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::size
memberdef.name: size

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of points that are stored in the tree.

memberdef.definition: Traits CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::traits
memberdef.name: traits

briefdescription.para: Returns the instance of the traits used to construct the tree.

memberdef.definition: Node_handle CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::root
memberdef.name: root

briefdescription.para: Returns a handle to the root node of the tree.

memberdef.definition: Node_const_handle CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::root
memberdef.name: root

briefdescription.para: Returns a const handle to the root node of the tree.

memberdef.definition: const Kd_tree_rectangle< FT, D > & CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::bounding_box
memberdef.name: bounding_box

briefdescription.para: Returns a const reference to the bounding box of the root node of the tree.

memberdef.definition: std::ostream & CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::statistics
memberdef.name: statistics

briefdescription.para: Inserts statistics of the tree into the output stream s.

memberdef.definition: std::ostream & CGAL::Kd_tree< Traits, Splitter, UseExtendedNode, EnablePointsCache >::write_graphviz
memberdef.name: write_graphviz

briefdescription.para: Inserts the tree in the Graphviz format into the output stream s.
The class Kd_tree defines a k-d tree.

parameterdescription.para: must be a model of the concept SearchTraits, for example Search_traits_2<Simple_cartesian<double> >.
must be a model for the concept Splitter. It defaults to Sliding_midpoint<Traits>.
must be Tag_true, if the tree shall be built with extended nodes, and Tag_false otherwise.

can be Tag_true or Tag_false. Not storing the points coordinates inside the tree usually generates a lot of cache misses, leading to non-optimal performance. This is the case for example when indices are stored inside the tree, or to a lesser extent when the points coordinates are stored in a dynamically allocated array (e.g., Epick_d with dynamic dimension) we says "to a lesser extent" because the points are re-created by the kd-tree in a cache-friendly order after its construction, so the coordinates are more likely to be stored in a near-optimal order on the heap. When EnablePointsCache is set to Tag_true, the points coordinates will be cached in an optimal way. This will increase memory consumption but provide better search performance. See also the GeneralDistance and FuzzyQueryItem concepts for additional requirements when using such a cache.
